speakers.name: Ava Gaiety Wroten
speakers.title: UI Engineer, Oncue
speakers.bio: üêï Canine pretending to be a web engineer üíª
speakers.talkTitle: Building the Dream UI Component Library
speakers.talkAbstract: A well made app is visually consistent, appealing, and usable. What does it look like to build a system that can engineers, designers, quality assurance, and product can use to make all of this happen? Let's dive into the standards and technologies that have gone into building the new design system at Oncue with accessibility and testing in mind.

speakers.name: Blake Watson
speakers.title: Frontend Engineer, MRI Technologies
speakers.bio: Web tinkerer and coder with a disability working on projects for NASA. Enjoys code, design, cheap coffee, and side projects.
speakers.talkTitle: Speaking in Code: Hands-Free Input with Talon
speakers.talkAbstract: Forget what you know about using speech recognition software. Talon makes it possible to code precisely by voice (and much more). Talon is configurable and scriptable with Python, which makes it flexible enough to fit any workflow. It‚Äôs great for people who have difficulty typing or anyone who wants to feel like they‚Äôre a powerful sorcerer bending technology to their will.

speakers.name: Dacey Nolan
speakers.title: Software Engineer - Publicist
speakers.bio: Dacey is a self-taught frontend software engineer. She is a Women in Tech mentor and is passionate about making the web accessible for all.

speakers.name: Dijah McDonald
speakers.bio: Dijah is a React developer that loves to learn about security while sipping too much chai.

speakers.name: Dustin Goodman
speakers.title: Engineering Manager, This Dot Labs
speakers.bio: Dustin Goodman is an engineer, tech speaker, and blogger with 10 years of experience in web development. He currently acts as an Engineering Manager at This Dot, and actively contributes free community resources through This Dot Media.

speakers.name: Gant Laborde
speakers.title: CIO of Infinite Red
speakers.bio: Gant Laborde is an owner of Infinite Red, mentor, adjunct professor, published author, and award-winning speaker. For 20 years, he has been involved in software development and continues strong today. He is recognized as a Google Developer Expert in Web and Machine Learning, but informally he is an ‚Äúopen sourcerer‚Äù and aspires to one day become a mad scientist. He blogs, videos, and maintains popular repositories for the community. Follow Gant‚Äôs adventures at https://gantlaborde.com/

speakers.name: Herbert "Satch" Brown
speakers.title: Instructor, Mississippi Coding Academies
speakers.bio: Satch is an instructor for the Mississippi Coding Academies, Jackson Campus. He has worked in nontraditional education for 15 years and has been a member of the academy since its inception in 2017.

speakers.name: Jen Luker
speakers.title: Senior Staff Frontend Engineer, Nav, Inc.
speakers.bio: Jen Luker is a knitter, quilter, accessibility advocate and Senior Staff Engineer working to make the collection of the world's knowledge available to everyone.

speakers.name: Justin Samuels
speakers.title: Senior Software Engineer
speakers.bio: Justin Samuels is a technologist and influencer of all things software engineering and underrepresented groups in technology. Having started Render-Atlanta to amplify developers' presence in the south, emphasizing culture and inclusion, Justin has become a pillar in the local Atlanta and global engineering community as a force to represent community building and engineering excellence. Justin has also started the Rebuild Black Business platform to amplify black-owned businesses' stories and treasures throughout the United States. He is also a full-time Senior Engineer at Mailchimp in Atlanta, where he helps empower small and medium-sized enterprises on their marketing platform.

speakers.name: Kent C. Dodds
speakers.title: JavaScript Engineer and Trainer at Kent C. Dodds Tech LLC
speakers.bio: Kent C. Dodds is a JavaScript engineer and teacher. He's also active in the open source community. He likes his family, JavaScript, and React.

speakers.name: Michael Liendo
speakers.title: Frontend/Serverless Consultant
speakers.bio: Frontend Engineer and Serverless Practitioner. AWS Community Builder.

speakers.name: Nader Dabit
speakers.title: Developer Relations Engineer, Edge and Node
speakers.bio: Developer, Author, Teacher, currently working as a Developer Relations Engineer at Edge and Node.

speakers.name: Sara McCombs
speakers.title: Software Engineer, Aiera
speakers.bio: Sara is a published former research director turned software engineer and team lead at Aiera, as well as a community engagement leader at Project Alloy. She is also one of the original organizers, and a current community maintainer, at Virtual Coffee. Sara is passionate about diversity and inclusion, and has written frequently about her journey into tech. She has an M.Ag and a B.S.Ag from West Virginia University, and is a 2020 graduate of Flatiron School.
speakers.talkTitle: Cows and the Art of Software Engineering
speakers.talkAbstract: As we all know, the first thing anyone thinks when talking about software engineering is cows... Right? No? Well, it's never too late to start. By recounting her own unique experiences, Sara will explain how even the most unusual life path is more translatable to software engineering than it may originally seem.

speakers.name: Shawn Swyx Wang
speakers.title: Head of Developer Experience, Temporal.io
speakers.bio: swyx has worked on React and serverless JavaScript at Two Sigma, Netlify and AWS, and now serves as Head of Developer Experience at Temporal.io. He has started and run communities for hundreds of thousands of developers, like Svelte Society, /r/reactjs, and the React TypeScript Cheatsheet. His nontechnical writing was recently published in the Coding Career Handbook for Junior to Senior developers.

speakers.name: Sia Karamalegos
speakers.title: Web Developer
speakers.bio: Sia Karamalegos is a developer, international conference speaker, and writer. She is a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies, a Cloudinary Media Developer Expert, and a Women Techmakers ambassador. She co-organizes GDG New Orleans and its marquee event, DevFest New Orleans. She is the founder and lead developer for Clio + Calliope Web Development and was recognized in the Silicon Bayou 100, the 100 most influential and active people in tech and entrepreneurship in Louisiana.

speakers.name: Tracy Lee
speakers.title: CEO and Co-Founder, This Dot Labs
speakers.bio: Organizer of This.JavaScript, Modern Web, Contributor Days, Google Developer Group, and RxWorkshop
